text:
“Facing the Truth”

A dim room, tension thickens.  
His face flushes with conviction.  
Raskolnikov: “I don’t see it as a crime!”  

Dounia’s eyes reflect deep anguish.  
Raskolnikov: “I’ve made you both miserable.”  

---

Outside, a cold street looms.  
Raskolnikov: “Forgive me, Dounia. It’s time to go.”  

Dounia: “Please don’t leave me!”  
Raskolnikov: “Be with mother. She needs you.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with his guilt and the impact of his actions on his loved ones, asserting his conviction that he is not a criminal despite his confession.
